bill_title: provide for state aid to certain school districts for transportation.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for state aid to certain school districts for transportation. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. A school district is eligible for state aid for transportation under the provisions of this Act if the school district's general enrollment average daily membership, as defined in § 13- 13-10.1, divided by the area of the school district in square miles results in a quotient that is less than one and if the school district's previous year's ending general fund cash balance is less than fifty percent of the previous year's general fund expenditures. Section 2. If a school district meets the criteria established in section 1 of this Act, the school district is entitled to state aid for transportation according to the following calculations: (1) Determine the school district's general enrollment average daily membership; (2) Determine the school district's general enrollment average daily membership attributable to students in grades kindergarten through eight; (3) Determine the school district's total bus route miles for vehicles owned by the school district or contracted bus service; (4) Divide the result of step (2) by the result of step (1); (5) Multiply the result of step (4) by the result of step (3); (6) Multiply the result of step (5) times $0.45. Section 3. The Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall distribute aid for transportation to eligible school districts in the same manner as other state aid to education distributed under the provisions of chapter 13-13. Section 4. The Department of Education and Cultural Affairs may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to provide such definitions and standards as may be necessary to implement the provisions of this Act.
